name: The Chester Grosvenor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chester Grosvenor for one night as a birthday treat, and found it to be a perfect spot for a special occasion. The hotel is found easily after announcing your arrival to a porter on entry to the pedestrianised centre of town. We took advantage of the valet parking which was a handy alternative to negotiating the one-way system to the NCP.
reviews.title: A 5 star experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel staff were all extremely welcoming and we were given a personal introduction to our room which was a nice touch. The room itself was a haven of luxury with a comfortable large bed, an abundance of pillows and plasma TV.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined at the Arkle which was a high point of our stay. It offered food that can be appreciated for the quality and combination of ingredients and attention to presention. The staff were very attentive and we were amazed by the expansive selection of bread. Breakfast was served at your table and the eggs Benedict were divine. An amazing 5 star experience!
reviews.title: wonderful break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is in a fantastic position in the centre of this very attractive city within easy walking distance of all the main sights.
reviews.title: Something a little special

likes.liked: — The personal service offered by the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were exceptional, and our room was very well maintained and a very good size.
reviews.title: one off treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel gave a very good first impression. Using the excellent map and directions on the website we drove up to the front of the hotel, which is bang in the middle of Chester. We were met by a top-hatted doorman who was very friendly and polite and our car was valet-parked within two minutes of our arrival. The front-of-house staff were also extremely friendly. The hotel was immaculately decorated and appears to be a "grande dame" hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel meant we were perfectly placed to explore the centre of Chester and the shops surrounding the hotel, which we did. We then had tea and read the newspapers in The Library at the hotel. We didn't take afternoon tea, but it looked excellent.
reviews.title: Great break
not impressed
reviews.text: We each had a massage at the hotel's spa. I am a mother-to-be and the spa seemed to specialise in massages for pregnant women. My therapist was excellent - apparently they practise on a pregnant colleague. My husband had a deep tissue massage and rated it one of the best he's ever had.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was great - newly refurbished and tastefully done. It lacked tea/coffee-making facilities, which we tend to expect, and the TV picture was very fuzzy, almost unwatchable. But we're nitpicking.
reviews.title: Superb Location , Staff Brilliant , One of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had dinner at La Brasserie in the hotel, because The Arkle restaurant was shut. We felt that the food could have been less fussy, more "bistro-style" and the staff didn't want to let us order dishes from a mix of the Specials and a la carte menus until we pushed them, explaining that I could not eat any of the normal starters due to pregnancy! However, this has been the case at other restaurants as well.
reviews.title: Top class quality

likes.liked: — The whole top quality thing - nothing too much trouble
likes.disliked: — Nothing at all - perhaps Chester traffic - hardly the fault of the hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having taking our very poorly golden retriever to the veterinary hospital in Northwich Cheshire we really felt like cheering ourselves up so walked in off the street into the Chester Grosvenor. Not many rooms available except the best room in the house. Being hoteliers we are not easily pleased but this was faultlessl The room was immaculate, the service was professional and friendly and dinner in the restaurant was exceptional. Nothing was to much trouble for the staff including the concierge who efficiently unloaded our luggage and valet parked the car ,retrieving it within minutes of our request on departure.When you walk into the lobby you are surrounded by highly polished brass and magnificent marble floors. We did not have time to use the spa so hopefully that will give us an excuse to go back . Would recommend to the most discerning of visitors
reviews.title: heaven on earth
Totally Fantastic!
reviews.text: This hotel is a totally amazing experience and I can receommend it to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: While we did not do this, I wish that we had been able to hermit ourselves away inside this hotel for a couple of days, there is absolutely no reason to go anywhere else. Every area of this hotel is inviting and luxurious and I wish that we were getting married again as I would definitely choose this place.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

likes.liked: — overall not a 5-star experience, and very overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you must leave the hotel, try the Siam Thai restaurant (the hotel will give you directions) - it is the best Thai food we have had and it was so good we went there for lunch the day after we had had dinner there.
reviews.title: Fantastic luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: ENJOY!
reviews.title: Elegant but not stuffy.

likes.disliked: — Room not as stunning as website pictures led me to expect. ( Same grade but v. different)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here with a friend for a short spa break. The experience started the minute our car door was opened for us and our bags carried into the hotel. The check in experience was efficient, the room was lovely, most cmnfortable bed Ive ever stayed inj. Only slight down point was the bathroom didnt seem to be up to the same standard, would have expected a stand alone shower, not one in the bath! The staff were lovely, dinner was beautiful, breakfast was incredible and really filling and the spa treatment was fantastic. Overall a lovely treat, felt like a princess for a day.
reviews.title: Beautiful classy hotel with fantastic food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel as my wife and I wanted to have dinner at the Simon Radley restaurant.
reviews.title: Too busy trying to get your last penny to be great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had stayed here before and chose to valet park rather than go to the car park. I have to say not a great choice on a Christmas shopping Saturday as you drive down the middle of Chesters pedestrianised main shopping street.- you are very conspicuous pulling up and it can be a bit nerve wracking avaoiding shoppers. However, door staff, valet parkers etc are exceleent and reception made the check in process painless.
reviews.title: Calm hotel in middle of bustling High Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was casually luxurious and had an unflashy , relaxed demeanour a bit like the BeveRly Hills Hotel).The room itself was good with a good bedroom, nice sitting area and dressing area and the bathroom, although small worked well. However, be warned that your view might be of a dingy car park.
reviews.title: Birthday-Bash with Style
Reliable excellence, quality staff and management....
reviews.text: The public areas (Brasserie and Radley bar) become over run with shoppers so you are better at times resorting to the second floor study and library and getting served there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: We stayed here for our anniversary and from start to finish our experience was excellent.
reviews.title: Simply excellent !
Old school luxury, courtesy and service
reviews.text: Our room was the Carlton Suite. The suite was excellent and so was the view. To be honest we are no strangers to 5 star hotels so everything was as you expected a 5 star suite to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really made our anniversary special was the service which if I was to use a word to describe this it would be 'exceptional'
reviews.title: short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we where greeted by the friendly doorman who swiftly took our car and baggage then we where taken to reception where my wife and I's seats where pulled out for us to sit and check in. We where then taken to the suite where we where shortly joined by our luggage. The list goes on but arriving, checking in, going to the bar breakfast in the room and drinks at the bar we were also made to feel very special. You don't normally associate this level of customer service at English hotels - 5 star or not - and the hotel Manager should be proud of their achievements. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Formal Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having done our research, we thought we knew what to expect, but from the moment the top-hatted gentleman took our luggage inside and took our car to park, we knew it was going to be even better. Our room was 218 facing the shopping street, a little noisy during the night but not something that bothered us. We had breakfast in the room the first morning, a wheeled table arriving for us to sit at with a special hot box for the hot food - very swish. After several hours of shopping in Chester we decided to have a nap in the room (while England v Australia rugby was on the box!) and ordered afternoon tea and sandwiches in the room. We went out for dinner so did not try the Simon Radley restaurant but imagine it is what it is billed as - perhaps a bit too posh for us!
reviews.title: Very Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grosvenor proved to be a very comfortable hotel with a good standard of service throughout. Arriving by car is a slight trial given Chester's one way system but do take advantage of the excellent valet parking at a very reasonable £8.50 per night. The Deluxe rooms are spacious and quiet (except for the super strong slam doors - haven't top class hotels heard of soft close?). Service in La Brasserie is generally good with only a slight wait for a breakfast table on a weekday morning.
reviews.title: Comfortable with good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall The Grosvenor should prove a comfortable and pleasant base for Chester's shopping and monuments.
reviews.title: Best house in the worst street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving 11am on a Saturday saw a small queue for the Grosvenor Shopping Centre car park of maybe 15 minutes, one in one out system. There is no reserved parking for hotel guests. The hotel has direct access from this car park between floor 2 and 3 and you will have a short walk to the hotel entrance as a result. Obtain an exit pass from reception on departure at a reduced rate £8.50,
reviews.title: Great hotel with exceptional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left our bags and spent a busy 3 hours christmas shopping. Our room was ready on our return and bags brought up shortly after. The room a classic double was fine for one night, for a longer stay I would prefer an upgrade though. I found it strange that there were no door closers fitted resulting in a loud bang when entering or leaving the room.
reviews.title: First class five star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had reserved a table at Simon Radley restaurant with our booking weeks ago, a good idea as people were being turned away on the night. Breakfast is waiter served and contintal included in the rate however £7.50 surcharge applies if having cooked english breakfast.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea in The Bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, I had read the reviews so had high expectations and I certainly wasn't disappointed, apart from one thing which I will mention later. We arrived on the Saturday booked in to stay for one night in a Deluxe room. We arrived early and as our room wasn't ready we left our luggage there and booked our meal for the evening. As the Radley Restaurant was fully booked we booked a meal at La Brasserie. After some shopping we came back to the hotel where we were shown to our room. The staff were polite, very helpful and just what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. We got to our room and were pleasantly surprised. Great size, huge bed, lovely bathroom and a mini bar. We had complementary robes and slippers which were for use in the Spa. We went straight to the spa to use the Thermal Suite which is £35 per room and were very underwhelmed. There was a foot spa which I was surprised had no bubble effect. My foot spa was slow moving when I pulled the plug out and smelt of eggs. We moved on to the Steam Room, which again had a cabbage smell and the floor was very dirty.....again, moved on to the Sauna, which was ok. I then went into the Salt Grotto which when I entered and pressed a button on the side emitted a very loud hissing noise and a light menthol fragrance filled the air....then it went very cold and I was just sat there.....underwhelmed. The tropical shower? Not worth a mention! Decided to move to the relaxation room where there were some nice beds and complementary drinks and magazines. This was the best bit. Certainly not worth the £35. Our meal at La Brasserie was first class. We ordered Scallops to start followed by Fillet Steak (the best we've ever had). Service was excellent and would definately recommend this to anybody. When we got back to our room, it had been turned down for the evening and a complementary bottle of water had been placed on either side of the bed which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic Hotel, Spa not so good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was not self service. Everything was brought to your table. As we were still pretty full from the night before, we just ordered a coffee and a basket of pastries, again which was lovely and set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Superb weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check out time of 12pm is ideal too. You could enjoy your breakfast and not worry about having to vacate your room early. Checking out was quick and easy. Would definately recommend this hotel and although I imagine the Spa treatments are good, I wouldn't recommend the Thermal Suite on its own, not at £35 anyway.
reviews.title: short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed in Chester at the best hotel. Very comfortable and welcoming staff. Excellent services and amenities. Room was exceptionally well maintained and maid service was very good. Restaurants were very good.
reviews.title: Evening meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Definitely recommend this hotel and will be staying again in the future.
reviews.title: Brilliant :-)
A shame
reviews.text: I stayed one night at the hotel and booked a table for two at The Arkle restaurant. I was shown to a pleasant looking room overlooking the front.. As the evening came, I felt cold and tried unsuccessfuly to turn the heating up. Eventually I called the porter who had to clamber up into the roof to "release" the air conditioning. He confessed the infrastructure was old and couldn't support the hotel, so they were upgrading. Sadly, it hadn't yet reached my room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: The Arkle is one star Michelin, so you expect something special. I thought it was aloof and prententious with some of the staff clearly feeling they were more important than the customers. One waitress in particular is teutonic and incredibly bossy. They sit couples adjacent, but on a round table, which is awkward. I am sorry, but there's more atmosphere in Chester Cathedral than this place.
reviews.title: Eat their desserts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, you get a choice from about 20 breads, but then when you ask for the duck well done and it turns up pink, you start to wonder how this place really manages to retain its Michelin year-on-year. We sent the meal back, but it still cost me £90 for one main course, one glass of wine, a gin and tonic and some water.
reviews.title: 5 star because your worth it !

likes.disliked: — Prices but you have to pay for quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware having a room looking over the shops at the front. Seems a great idea in the afternoon when you look out on the bustling street. Not so clever when the Thornton's Delivery lorry rolls up and unloads at 5.30am. Other lorries arrive to ensure you don't get back to sleep.
reviews.title: Great on the Surface

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall, lovely building, some very pleasant and some unpleasant staff, good location for shopping but not sleeping, and an overpriced, overbearing and overachieving restaurant. .
reviews.title: Very high standard of excellence, exceptional service

description: Located in the heart of beautiful Chester, the Grade II listed building, with its black and white timbered façade belies the modern elegance of the interior. The hotel offers both relaxed Parisian style dining and an exquisite Michelin star experience along with luxurious bedrooms and a heavenly spa.
